text:
Robert Fisk (12 July 1946 – 30 October 2020) an English writer and journalist. He was a Middle East correspondent from 1976 until his death for many medias. From 1989 until his death, he was a correspondent for "The Independent". Fisk was born in Maidstone, Kent.
Fisk studied at Lancaster University and at Trinity College Dublin.
He was a known Arabic speaker, he was the few Western journalists to interview Osama bin Laden. He interviewed him three times between 1993 and 1997.
Fisk died of a stroke on 30 October 2020 at a Dublin, Ireland hospital at the age of 74.
